summary: The 'Preservation and Reinvestment Initiative for Community Enhancement Act' (PRICE Act) proposes a grant program to improve manufactured housing communities. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will award funds to eligible recipients (including communities, local governments, and nonprofits) for projects such as infrastructure improvements, housing repairs, resident health/safety activities, and community services. The bill prioritizes projects benefiting low- and moderate-income residents and preserving affordability. The Secretary can waive regulations as needed, excluding fair housing, nondiscrimination, labor standards, and environmental requirements.
